basics.name: Alexander Lum
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Aloha, I am a fourth-year Computer Engineering student at UH Manoa. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2020.

work.company: UH Manoa Marine Embedded Systems Laboratory
work.summary: Establishing a wireless real-time coastal monitoring network around the state, used to assist with environmental restoration and management efforts
highlights: Designing and constructing waterproof sensor housings using SolidWorks and 3D printers (FDM/SLA)
Configuring data collecting instruments such as rain and tidal gauges, dissolved oxygen meters, CTDs (conductivity, temperature, and depth), and salinity sensors using Python

work.summary: Fabricated inexpensive lighting products powered by thermoelectric generators
highlights: Developed and assembled a novel multi-tool flashlight and other lighting products such as headlamps and reading lights using Fusion360 to accommodate various circuit designs
Support developing countries and locations affected by natural disasters through NGO partnership

work.summary: Assisted professor with grading studentsâ€™ code for entry-level programming class
highlights: Created answer keys for weekly C-programming assignments
Communicated with the professor at weekly meetings to provide feedback on student performance and suggested topics for teaching assistants to focus on each week
Bridge Correspondent, Eta Kappa Nu Electrical/Computer Engineering Honor Society, 2019-Present
Member, Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Student Branch, 2019-Present

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team completed the maze in the fastest time

awards.title: Everett E. Black Scholarship
awards.summary: Full tuition scholarship to University of Hawaii at Manoa
